intro: Malcolmia micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered malcolmia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Malcolmia micrantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
